channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Blocked gulley causing flooding and risk to my property and the public, 8th January
item.description:
Previously reported in December but was informed no action to be taken, which was very surprising considering the issue has been reported in the past and unblocked by the Highways team. This needs to be cleaned as Rats will start to materialise, based on previous experiences.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Edison Grove, Plumstead
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fuel Spill, 8th January
item.description:
Outside the BT telephone exchange there is a big fuel spill. It is on the road and also along the pavement. It runs for at least 10m. It looks like someone has tried to clear some of it up with red grit but there is still a lot of excess that hasn't been treated. I think it happened yesterday as I could smell it (from around 100m away) but today I saw how bad it was when I walked that way.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Grove Park Road, Mottingham, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Width Restriction Post, courtyard of Townsend House Strathnairn Street SE1 5BU, 8th January
item.description:
Width Restriction Post Was removed by contractors who are upgrading gas pipes. This was so they could get their digger and other construction vehicles into the courtyard. It seems to gave vanished and the holes that it was placed in tarmac over by the contractors. It should be replaced ASAP It was placed there to stop motor vehicles being driven into the block. Photo 1 shows one remaining. Photo 2 shows where missing post should be.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Strathnairn Street, Bermondsey, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree outside 5 glendale way needs to be pruned back, 8th January
item.description:
There is a large tree outside 5 glendale way, its growing that large that the branches are touching the roof. Resident is concerned that this may damage the roof and cause a leak. Please can this be looked into urgently.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Glendale Way, Greater London

item.title: The whole road needs tree and leaf detritus removing, 8th January
item.description:
I have complained about this twice now and both times you have told me it's been seen to. I don't know which road your visiting but it's not Alexandra Road. It's still a terrible mess. Gutters are in a bad state. Haven't been done properly for years. Has to be done by hand like you did in Maitland Road a couple of weeks ago. Thank you.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Alexandra Road, Penge, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Drainage problem, 8th January
item.description:
Pembroke Road was tarmacked yesterday. Unfortunately, the job was done incorrectly. There is now a drainage problem on Pembroke Road. In addition, Pembroke Road has a history of dangerous flooding.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Pembroke Road, Northumberland Heath, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Council house left to become derelict in conservation area and area of historic interest. Left to subside by council., 8th January
item.description:
This cottage is council owned and in both a conservation area and area of historic interest adjacent to the moated manor. The property has been left with subsidence getting and progressively worse. It has now become uninhabitable and has large holes in roof. This historic property within scadbury Park is council owned and is in need of immediate repair as it is now structurally unsound. The house has suffered subsidence for some years now but fear that the elevation is at a critical point. The crack is several centre metres and extends from the ground floor to the middle of the 1st floor.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): The Drive, St Paul's Cray, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dog fouling is still there., 8th January
item.description:
The dog fouling is still there. It has been stepped in multiple times and spread across the pavement. As it has snowed and been raining it has turned to mush, but is still very much there but hard to see in the wet weather. If you look carefully you can se

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Christie Road, Hackney, London
